data.title: AI doesn't build MCVs to expand it's base
data.body: MCVs have their own AI (moving around and deploying), so the AI could build up to 5-6 MCVs randomly (not if it has 5-6 construction yards) in order to get better building speed, map control, nuke/Tanya prevention, ...

data.title: Battlefield News not read
data.body: Despite the fact that the upcoming tournament is announced in the Battlefield News, few people are aware of it. It means that only few people "open" the Battlefield News. Could you show it opened by default ?

data.title: Artillery/V2 : predict the future position of an enemy before shooting
data.body:
Maybe not for human artillery/v2 but the AI would be more dangerous.

data.title: Getting a crate from a badger only by shooting at it
data.body: So the badgers are just "chests" flying randomly above the map, and if you don't hit them (or destroy them, so #3768) they simply fly through the map without giving anything ?

data.title: Documentation on official maps
data.body:
The upcoming tournament will be played on "the shipped maps" but my maps folder has more than one hundred maps, so I don't know what are the official maps.
I had to delete some maps to reinstall them and I also had to install new releases of OpenRA, so it's a bit difficult to know it now.
Could you add a simple list of the official maps shipped with OpenRA somewhere (I didn't find it in the documentation) ?

data.title: Observe a player's point of view
data.body: As a spectator it might be interesting to observe the point of view of a player (without his cursor and the movements of his cursor of course), like seeing his screen in real time.

data.title: [Attack everything]-move order
data.body:
The attack-move order allows to attack a visible enemy when moving but doesn't allow to attack automatically barrels, civilian buildings/units, and maybe other objects, so when you encounter (dangerous) barrels or civilian things (where you want to deploy) you have to destroy every object manually, one by one.
Is it possible to add a special attack-move order so the units attack absolutely everything they can attack except teammates ?

data.title: Bazooka vs bazooka can be an infinite fight if they are in front of each other
data.body:
![bazooka vs bazooka](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/5189309/ca1edd0c-74dc-11e4-951b-0bed359e8ca5.png)
I don't know if it should be considered as a bug but missiles' physics can randomly prevent missiles from reaching their target if the target is in an adjacent subcell to the bazooka.
Is it possible to ignore physics if a bazooka has to shoot in a subcell next to him ?

data.title: incorrect crono position
data.body:
(release 1029) 
ive played a 1v1 today , my plan was to crono the enemy units into my own units , so i can destroy them (and then take the husks with mechanics) 

i did choose a mammoth and a heavy ... the first try ... activate crono , units dissapear ... radar shows a beacon on the position where i did click with my mouse .... the units didnt appear ... instead , they teleportet up on a wrong spot (see screenshot in my next comment) ... ~~(but gone from the old position)~~
~~after the crono is over ... the units magically appear on their old position~~
~~in this game~~ ... every crono failed ... 
i couldnt reproduce this bug ... tried it in several games ... but no luck ... i do have a replay though

00:13:42 - mammoth/heavy 
00:15:58 - mammoth/heavy/mad 
00:18:14 - mammoth/heavy/mad 
... and around 20 minutes ... again

https://www.dropbox.com/s/zxb64d1ktyh56bm/microbit%20crono%20bug%20.rep?dl=0

data.title: changing mobile gap / tesla tank for more complex gameplay
data.body:
TeslaTank
Add the ability to use a Emp-Blast on a small radius around the Tesla Tank (keep the weapon on it) ... with long Recharge-Time ... disabling Vehicle Engines and Turrets ...stationary or mobile ... for a small amount of time (less then recharge time) 
Buildings  , Aircraft , Infantry and Tesla Tank itself are not effected from the Emp 
*maybe have effect on ships ... (demo truck and mad shouldnt work at all , no activate)
- good vs cronoed Units
- should have effect on cronosphere/Ironcurtain/missile silo/gps(techc.) .... causing a interference
  on the countdown ... so it takes longer for the support power to finish ... 
- cant shoot while recharging!  

![tesla blast](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/5167971/c7f5ee3a-73fb-11e4-938e-dc00ea2f087b.png)

Mobile Gap Generator 
Add the ability to act as a "lightning protector" ... with the range of a Tesla Coil ... forcing Tesla-Lightning to aim at the Mobile Gap when its range is crossing the Tesla (coil , tank and shok)... 
raised lightning-resistance so it can survive a couple of tesla hits ... 

![gap new](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/5168219/85698642-73fd-11e4-9442-dde18202e475.png)

data.title: access to build-menu delayed when deploying
data.body:
i dont know if that is intended ... but theres a delay between "deploying" a mcv ... and having access to the build menu ... im talking about bleed

looks like i have only access when it is fully deployed  ... which is a regression towards "fluid" gameplay . Not to mention the situation when you have to make a emergency-deploy because your mcv is on fire , and you have to start building immediately

![openra speed up](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/5164137/df761dc8-73d3-11e4-874c-f46738af4c37.png)

data.title: Speed up ShroudRenderer.UpdateShroud.
data.body:
Testing for shrouded/fogged tiles requires GetEdges to run the isVisible delegate 9 times per cell. This delegate can be fairly cheap or somewhat expensive. As a result, it's faster to test visibility for tiles in the region ahead of time and cache the results - this means the delegate is only run 1 time per cell instead of 9. The GetEdges method can then perform its 9 way checks against the array which is far less costly. This makes UpdateShroud about 2x as fast overall.

I observed CPU usage for UpdateShroud drop from 6.4% to 3.1% of all time spent in some profiling I ran.

data.title: Strange UI problem with BuildPaletteWidget
data.body:
In a mod I'm working on the build palette doesn't open automatically when deploying my construction yard, I have to click on it manually to open. Which is weird, because it's essentially the current TS UI.

Any idea what the cause might be and how to fix it?

The mod can be found here:
https://github.com/reaperrr/OpenRA/tree/1-TDX

data.title: Color coded the server browser and added a filter for password protected games
data.body:
This implements #4495 and applies the color code style from www.openra.net/games/ with a legend:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/5157404/c3e91e68-7309-11e4-9c5c-22fa5eface1e.png)

Essentially a followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6983 whose game name + "(Password)" was a little too subtle and unpolished for my taste.

data.title: The new Prerequisites implementation - please bring back the Owner: trait.
data.body:
Hi guys. I've been having a really tough time with the current Prerequisites implementation. Assigning the same unit to 2 or 3 out of four sides (my mod Tiberian Origins has 4 sides) is quite difficult now that the Owner trait is defunct. To get my mod working again, I've had to clone a lot of buildings just to be able to assign certain units to a specific race. For example - 3 out of 4 sides can build a helipad. Allies have HPAD, and GDI and NOD have GPAD (CnC .shp). The allies have the Apache helicopter, GDI has the Orca, and NOD has the Banshee gunship (RA hind.shp). For me to be able to assign these units to just one side, I had to code 3 helipad buildings (HPAD, GPAD and NPAD), otherwise there is no way to make individual aircraft available to one side only buildable trough the same structure.

The above mentioned is just an example... assigning units and structures for single player missions is even harder - I have to code almost the entire rules file in the mission.yaml! My mod has missions in witch you can build the RA war factory, and later the GDI war factory / NOD airstrip as the game progresses. Previously, i just needed to put the Owner trait in the mission's yaml for what you can and can't build / who can build it - but with the current system it's very hard.

T;L DNR - PLEASE BRING BACK THE OWNER: TRAIT!

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/6455000-the-new-prerequisites-implementation-please-bring-back-the-owner-trait?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Talk to specific player?
data.body:
I mean in FFA game, when (2 or more) of you aren't in the same team and obviously enemies, but it would be nice if you can secure a "backroom deal" mid-game (to attack the strongest player first, or even mis-leading them so you can stab them on the back), kinda dealing in Molotov-Ribbentorp sense via Chat, so it obviously require a non-public chat between those two players.

It could also work better to secure alliance deal as well (in games with diplomatic changes mid-game)

data.title: Reduce enum memory
data.body: TextureChannel and BlendMode enums are both used in the Sprite class - since there are so many sprites reducing the footprint of these enums from ints to bytes saves a small amount of memory.

data.title: Prune neighbor sets based on direction we arrived at a cell
data.body:
This is one of the ideas from 'Jump Point Search', which can be implemented without making too many assumptions about the cost function.

Just don't even consider directions where a path through this cell would be worse than a path including our parent but NOT ourselves.

data.title: The pathfinding must be fixed......
data.body:
I think the pathfinding system right now make 2 big problems

1.the performance drops when many units moving over the map.
2.the pathfinding dont work very well because i has seen very often that the units stuck because the cant chose between right and left or don't want move backwards to avoid an barriers.

So here are some pathfinding examples:
http://www.codeofhonor.com/blog/the-starcraft-path-finding-hack
http://harablog.wordpress.com/2011/08/26/fast-pathfinding-via-symmetry-breaking/
http://code.activestate.com/recipes/577457-a-star-shortest-path-algorithm/

data.title: Fixed yaml bug with leading spaces
data.body:
The yaml decoder could not read yaml files that used spaces instead of tabs.

I also improved the error output for the yaml reader a little.

data.title: Cleaned up the server browser
data.body: Now reports maxplayers using number of open server slots with a fallback to map.PlayerCount until the master server is updated to include the feature. Removed duplicate methods.

data.title: AttackLoyalty differences to original D2k
data.body:
There's a couple of differences here and also general quirks.
1. This is the worst IMO. AttackLoyalty takes affect as soon as the weapon is fired not when the warhead hits. This is just generally bad IMO for any use of it but also in D2k it took affect when the unit was hit directly. AttackLoyalty should IMO become a warhead property.
2. It never wears off. In D2k the deviator affect was not permanent.
3. The turncoat unit often continues to follow it's previous owners order, even attack orders, making it damage your own units. In the original game it simple stopped whatever it was doing and this is generally a better thing too IMO.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/6389247-attackloyalty-differences-to-original-d2k?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Humvee and Buggies damage
data.body:
The damage modifiers of these two units do way to much vs armored. Did a game in 1v1 and 2v2 where they are able to destroy Harvestors pretty quickly along with buildings.

The humvees were able to destroy APCs relatively quickly aswell as light tanks. 

Its possible that they do a seemingly large amount of damage is because of their five shot burst fire. But if that is reduced to a single fire like in CNC95 that may present issues vs infantry. Since the infantry were improved in their range vs humvees and buggies to prevent range kiting. 

If its possible to have their armor vs damage reduced.

EDIT: Maybe a reduction to 15%.
